data.name: Flee, Mortals
entries: Monster Packet 1 is here! Inside, you'll find some MCDM orcs, voiceless talkers, and forest creatures. While these creatures have been playtested and edited, they aren't necessarily the final stat blocks you'll see in the book. If you'd like to let us know what you think about these critters, come chat about them in the {@link MCDM Discord server|https://mcdm.gg/discord}.

Good news! If you've run fifth edition, then you already understand how to use most of the creatures in this book. You may see a few unfamiliar details, but fear not; the tweaks we made to creature stat blocks don't take much time at all to grok.

entries.name: Using These Creatures
entries: The creatures in this book generally follow the core rules, but we've made a few tweaks.

entries.name: Challenge Rating
entries: Each creature's stat block lists their challenge rating in the top right corner. The more obvious placement of the challenge rating makes it easier to find stat blocks and build encounters to challenge your players.

entries.name: Creature Roles
entries: Each creature has a role listed next to their challenge rating. Roles are descriptive and typically don't include rules. Most simply help you build encounters and utilize the creature effectively in combat.

entries.name: Ambusher
entries: Ambushers are creatures who hide well—not just before an encounter, but during it. They utilize surprise and stealth to gain the upper hand.

entries.name: Artillery
entries: Artillery creatures fight best from afar. Whether they wield arrows or magical rays, these creatures always try to keep a distance from their foes.

entries.name: Brute
entries: Brutes are hardy creatures who have lots of hit points and deal lots of damage. They might not be the most disciplined warriors, but they make up for it in sheer toughness and aggression.

entries.name: Companion
entries: Companion creatures are meant to accompany player characters on adventures. For more information, see "Companion Creatures" on page 18.

entries.name: Controller
entries: Controllers debuff, move, and obstruct their enemies. They often have crowd control actions that target multiple creatures at once or apply a debilitating effect to a target.

entries.name: Leader
entries: A leader is an action-oriented creature who fights alongside underlings. For more information, see "ActionOriented Creatures" on page 17.

entries.name: Minion
entries: Minions are weak creatures who find strength in numbers. For more information, see "Minions" on page 21.

entries.name: Retainer
entries: Retainers are Humanoids meant to accompany player characters on adventures. For more information, see "Retainers" on page 20.

entries.name: Skirmisher
entries: Skirmishers are mobile warriors that use hit-and-run tactics in combat. Their traits allow them to make the most of their position.

entries.name: Soldier
entries: Soldiers are well-armored creatures who draw the attacks of their foes, freeing allies to move around the battlefield. These trained warriors typically have higher attack bonuses and AC.

entries.name: Solo
entries: A solo creature is an action-oriented creature who can take on the player characters on their own. For more information, see "Action-Oriented Creatures" on page 17.

entries.name: Support
entries: Support creatures aid their allies, providing buffs, healing, movement, or action options.

entries.name: Other New Rules
entries: If you want to learn more about the new rules, like the dazed condition, we've put into Flee, Mortals, flip to "New Rules" on page 17.

data.name: Orcs

entries: "I want to fight!"
"Yes, so did I at your age," Tovokor said to his niece.
"But you'll not fight until you burn for it."
"I burn!"
The warrior chuckled and deftly snatched the spear from his niece's hands. "You've got fire in your eyes, I can see it. But when you're ready, when you burn, the whole world will know."

In a long-lost language, the word oruk—"blood fire"—described the glowing appearance of the orc people when they push themselves to their limits. While orcs know one other as kanin in their own tongue, they also use "orc" with great pride, especially when dealing with other folk. Orc history spans the world and all its ages. They've settled into villages and cities, hot and cold climates, high in the mountains and deep underground. Most orcs live in diverse humanoid societies, though a few live secluded in the tropics.

Though orcs are no more likely to stand in the adventurers' way than any other folk, those who do fill the same roles as other humanoids: mercenaries, bounty hunters, garroters, guards, cultists, and corrupt kings.

entries.name: Relentlessly Tough
entries: Orcs grow to impressive heights. The veins that commonly stripe their tough-skinned faces can appear more vibrant when they're excited or driven. Their hair, which can range from coarse to fine, extends from their heads and drapes across their shoulders like royal mantles. Strong tusks extend past their lips and guard the rest of their teeth.

Few other humanoids can match the endurance of an orc, and orcs who train for hunting and combat can rally themselves to move faster and prevail longer. Should an orc find themself on the brink of death, their veins instinctively surge with "blood fire," glowing brightly and invigorating them to perform one last attack. Blood fire often appears red, though orcs from the mountains and underground glow blue and white respectively.

entries.name: Innate Power
entries: The intense power of an orc's spirit occasionally manifests as raw magic. Orc conduits hone their magic into singular affinities that are easy to manipulate. Orc terranovas move their magic through their feet, surging into the earth. Orc godcallers use song to spark the magic inherent in every creature's spirit.

entries.name: Mohler
entries: Mohlers are spined, pig-like beasts that corkscrew through the ground faster than they can run. Originating from deserts and forests, these burrowing creatures produce shallow networks of tunnels just below the surface.

Where orcs go, mohlers are sure to follow. In times of peace, orcs domesticate them to plow the earth and eat pests—and in times of war, mohlers reshape the battlefield and knock the orcs' enemies off their feet.

entries.name: Scyza
entries: Orcs rely on giant flightless birds called scyzas to carry them over great distances. Orcs adorn these mounts, which originated in the tropics, with great harnesses of interconnected gondolas that freely swing along their thick plumage. The birds are fearless in the face of danger, making them perfect battle mounts.

The scyza's trunk-like legs and talons cleave through the ground and kick up terrible dust storms. Worse still are their razor-sharp beaks and crests, which emit a terrible, bone-shaking ringing sound.

entries.name: Dohma Raskovar
entries: Dohma Raskovar is the latest in a long line of leaders—known as dohmas—of the Ivory Throne, a band of mercenaries. Under Raskovar's leadership, the throne has grown to over a hundred strong, and now they handle multiple contracts simultaneously, occasionally banding together to fight as a single unit in battle.

Raskovar runs the throne from the Hanging Tree, his tavern where he plays the role of barkeep. Here, clients in the know can discreetly indicate their desire to hire bounty hunters, cutthroats, or thieves by ordering a boiling oil, a mundane blend of whiskey and rum that appears on no menu.

Once the drink is ordered, Raskovar himself appears at the table, ready to do business. He prides himself on remaining politically neutral and treating all potential customers as equals, something that chafes a few of his clients. Many local nobles have stormed out of the Hanging Tree in a rage after Raskovar refused to use the proper forms of address—only to return later when their situation is more desperate, and pride too costly.

entries.name: Stat Blocks
entries: This section contains the orc stat blocks.

data.name: Voiceless Talkers
entries: Among the most powerful psions in the timescape, synlirii (singular: synliroi) are known as the "voiceless talkers" to the denizens of the World Below—and to surface dwellers unfortunate enough to encounter them. Descended from boneless aquatic cephalopods, they are alien in thought and motivation to the humanoid species they loathe. Synlirii consider the "barking ones" (their label for creatures who squeeze air through meat flaps to communicate) to be a corrupt branch of the evolutionary tree—an abomination that must be corrected.

entries.name: Uneasy Alliances
entries: Though synlirii and overminds are hereditary enemies, their mutual obsession with the barking ones often leads to uneasy alliances. Both synlirii and overminds employ humanoids from the World Below as agents, trading lore and technology for information on their surface foes.

entries.name: Aboleth Hatred
entries: The synlirii's visceral antipathy toward the barking ones is surpassed only by their deep enmity toward (and fear of) aboleths. Ancient myths say aboleths created both synlirii and overminds. To overminds, this is a harmless fable. But synlirii, who style themselves as the future masters of the timescape, rage against implications their powers come from any source other than their own superior development.

entries.name: Psionic Spies
entries: Despite their mental powers, voiceless talkers consider information their greatest weapon. They use their psionic talents to manipulate memory and perception, obscure their form, and pass undetected among other cultures.

entries.name: Psi-Tech
entries: Synlirii breed mollusks that secrete plasticlike substances, using them to fashion weapons and similar technology powered by psionic crystals. The voiceless talkers' handheld psi-pistols and portable psirifles can only be used by their alien minds.

entries.name: Creature Engineers
entries: Synlirii are obsessed with manipulating the natural development of other organisms. They create hulking brains, mindkillers, and other servants using a psionic technique they call the Interlace. Many synlirii experiments don't live long and aren't intended to. But the World Below is littered with unnatural creatures who escaped the voiceless talkers' body banks—most of them singular life forms that can't reproduce and may never die.

entries.name: Psi-Tech
entries: While most psi-tech weapons can only be used by voiceless talkers, a character using the talent class (from the upcoming MCDM supplement The Talent and Psionics) can use these weapons by gaining 1 strain each time they make an attack with it. A creature using a psi-tech ranged weapon uses Intelligence instead of Dexterity for attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: Hulking Brain
entries: The voiceless talkers have engineered gray-skinned, humanoid-shaped aberrations with four massive arms and—in place of a head—a large pulsing brain. Called thylin√ßa by voiceless talkers and hulking brains by everyone else, these creatures serve as bodyguards and psionic batteries for their synlirii masters.

entries.name: Mindkiller
entries: Floating clawed brains with a trailing spinal column and nerves, mindkillers serve as the voiceless talkers' pets and lackeys. These amorphous parasites can force themselves into a humanoid's body through the ear, eye, or nose, then devour the victim's central nervous system while replacing it with their own tissue. When the process is complete, the mindkiller gains all the victim's knowledge and memories and can puppet the body, becoming the perfect spy for the mindkiller's synlirii overlords.

Mindkiller whelps are a lesser form of mindkiller that can be created in a fraction of the time. While they can't inhabit bodies, their mere presence weakens their foes' mental defenses against psionics.

entries.name: Lord Syuul
entries: Chief Design Architect of his nation's body banks, the synliroi Lord Syuul seeks more material for his experiments. His spies, informants, and allies are always on the lookout for subjects with unique hereditary traits the Interlace might extract.

Lord Syuul, who belongs to an ancient and respected noble house, never leaves his estate without a retinue of guards and minions. They obey his orders fanatically—as Syuul has ensured they're biologically incapable of refusing.

Syuul's recent experiments have focused on isolating the trait that expresses sorcerous ability in humanoids. Thus far, these attempts have been unsuccessful. Not to be deterred, Lord Syuul has placed his assistant in charge of the day-to-day operations of the body banks, while Syuul himself ventures forth to observe the surface world and plunder its diversity.

entries.name: Stat Blocks
entries: This section contains the voiceless talker stat blocks.

entries.name: Absolute Evil
entries: Voiceless talkers are evil sapient beings who engage in reprehensible and irredeemable acts of eugenics. While you can create exceptional synlirii who fight against such philosophies and practices, the voiceless talkers who participate in genetic experiments are unquestionably evil.

data.name: Enchanted Forest

entries: He who has no dreams, let him go to a beautiful forest to have many.

Magic permeates nature. From fulminating thunderstorms to nurturing berries, nature answers when adventurers seek its verdant potency. Where planar veils are thin, ancient spirits dwell, or ley lines emanate wild energy, enchanted forests await with mesmerizing creatures and mysteries.

entries.name: Enchanted Forest Traits
entries: You can create an enchanted forest version of an existing creature by taking their stat block and adding one or more of the following traits:

items.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The enchanted forest creature can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they share a language.

items.name: Tree Stride
entries: Once per turn, the enchanted forest creature can use 10 feet of their movement to step magically into one living tree within reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be the same size category as the enchanted forest creature or bigger.

items.name: Living Forest
entries: A writhing grove thrives in a 30-foot radius centered on the enchanted forest creature. Mist lightly obscures that area, and colorful vines and shifting foliage make its ground {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. Teasing voices laugh and whisper, giving other creatures in that area disadvantage on saving throws made to maintain concentration on spells and similar effects. Flickering lights extinguish magical darkness in that area created by spells of 3rd level or lower. (When adding this trait to a creature, you can choose to exclude one or more of these effects.)

entries.name: Enchanted Forest Lair Actions
entries: You can create a more formidable version of an existing creature who lives in an enchanted forest by giving them the following lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the enchanted forest creature can take one of the following lair actions; the enchanted forest creature can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row.

items.name: Frothing Flora
entries: The enchanted forest creature causes roots and vines to temporarily grow around them; until initiative count 20 on the next round, the ground within 30 feet of the enchanted forest creature is {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

items.name: Writhing Roots
entries: Foliage in the enchanted forest creature's lair becomes a conduit for the enchanted forest creature's power. The enchanted forest creature can target creatures of their choice that are touching such plant life within 90 feet of the enchanted forest creature. A target must succeed on a {@dc 10} plus PB Wisdom saving throw or take PBd6 psychic damage and be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 10} plus PB).

items.name: Faerie Lights
entries: The enchanted forest creature creates dancing lights in a 20-foot cube at a point they can see within 120 feet of them. Each creature in that area who can see the lights must make a {@dc 10} plus PB Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is {@condition blinded}, outlined in light, and sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius until the end of initiative count 20 on the next round. {@action Attack} rolls against an affected creature have advantage if the attacker can see them, and the affected creature can't benefit from being {@condition invisible}.

entries.name: Dancing Lady
entries: Strange visions in the mist are to be expected in enchanted forests, but in the case of the dancing lady, these figures aren't illusions—they're real ... sort of.

The dancing lady is an enormous plant with white humanoid-sized flowers resembling figures in dresses. Large red and green leaves surround these hanging blooms. The dancing lady lurks around fey populations or other forest denizens, flowers peacefully turning until a threat appears. Once the plant's allies are endangered, the dancing lady's oversized flowers spring into dizzying dances to addle and frighten foes.

entries.name: Empyrean Stag
entries: As Celestial wardens of the forest, empyrean stags appear only to defend forest denizens from great threats or to warn mortals about forthcoming calamities. Their white fur is dappled with blue, and their eyes shine with the darkness of night.

entries.name: Unyielding Defenders
entries: Adventurers often clash with forest denizens, from hungry owlbears to mischievous fey. This violence draws an empyrean stag's ire, often provoking a deadly attack from the stag and their forest allies. Repentant adventurers can make restitution by helping the stag defend the wood from an even greater threat.

entries.name: Divine Knowledge
entries: Those who impress an empyrean stag—typically by protecting the forest—are allowed to ask the stag one question, which the Celestial answers truthfully to the best of their ability. Between their antlers, they can show shimmering visions of the present or glimpses of the future. The horns glow gold when the stag aids an ally, and white when they divine information.

entries.name: Stat Blocks
entries: This section contains the enchanted forest stat blocks.

trait.name: Gnashing Horde
entries: If a hostile creature the blitzer can see starts their turn within 5 feet of three or more blitzers, the creature takes 1 piercing damage for each blitzer within 5 feet of them.

trait.name: Minion
entries: If the blitzer takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the blitzer takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum, otherwise they take no damage.

trait.name: Relentless Minion
entries: When the blitzer isn't {@condition incapacitated} and is reduced to 0 hit points, they can deal 1 piercing damage to a hostile creature within 5 feet of them.

action.name: Spear (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or ranged 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

trait.name: Relentless (1/Turn)
entries: When the bloodrunner isn't {@condition incapacitated} and they are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, they can make an attack against a hostile creature (no action required) before the hit point reduction is resolved. If the attack hits and its damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the bloodrunner drops to 1 hit point instead of 0 hit points.

trait.name: Unimpeded
entries: The bloodrunner can occupy a {@condition prone} creature's space. The first time the bloodrunner enters a {@condition prone} creature's space on the bloodrunner's turn, the {@condition prone} creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage. When a {@condition prone} creature in the bloodrunner's space stands up, the creature enters the nearest unoccupied space of their choice.

action.name: Spiked Shield
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage. If the bloodrunner moves at least 10 feet before hitting a Large or smaller creature with this attack, the bloodrunner can choose to knock the target {@condition prone} or push them up to 10 feet away.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Juke
entries: When the bloodrunner makes a Dexterity saving throw, they can gain advantage on the save. To do so, the bloodrunner can't be {@condition prone}, {@condition grappled}, or {@condition restrained}.

resist.special: determined by the conduit's affinity trait

trait.name: Affinity
entries: The conduit has a lifelong affinity for one of the following damage types: cold, fire, or lightning. The chosen type determines the conduit's damage resistance and the damage of their Elemental Discharge and Power Burst actions.

trait.name: Relentless (1/Turn)
entries: When the conduit isn't {@condition incapacitated} and they are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, they can make an attack against a hostile creature (no action required) before the hit point reduction is resolved. If the attack hits and its damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the conduit drops to 1 hit point instead of 0 hit points.

action.name: Elemental Discharge (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) damage of the type determined by the conduit's Affinity trait.

action.name: Power Burst (2/Day; 1st-Level Spell)
entries: The conduit unleashes explosive energy in a 15-foot cone. The ground in that area becomes difficult terrain, and each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage of the type determined by the conduit's Affinity trait, and they are pushed 10 feet away from the conduit.
On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

bonus.name: Rush
entries: The conduit takes the Dash action.

trait.name: Relentless (1/Turn)
entries: When the fury isn't {@condition incapacitated} and they are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, they can make an attack against a hostile creature (no action required) before the hit point reduction is resolved. If the attack hits and its damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the fury drops to 1 hit point instead of 0 hit points.

action.name: Haymaker Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) slashing damage, or 12 ({@damage 1d12 + 6}) slashing damage if the target is {@condition prone}. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, they must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Healing Rally (1/Day)
entries: The fury regains 5 hit points.

trait.name: Relentless (1/Turn)
entries: When the garroter isn't {@condition incapacitated} and they are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, they can make an attack against a hostile creature (no action required) before the hit point reduction is resolved. If the attack hits and its damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the garroter drops to 1 hit point instead of 0 hit points.

action.name: Strangle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). Until the grapple ends, the target can't speak intelligibly or cast spells with verbal components. If the attack was made with advantage, the target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target falls {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute (save ends at start of turn) or until they take damage. A creature can use an action to shake another creature awake who falls {@condition unconscious} this way.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage. If the attack was made with advantage, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Cloak (1/Day)
entries: The garroter magically turns {@condition invisible} for 1 minute. Any equipment the garroter wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with them. While {@condition invisible}, the garroter's movements make no sound. If the garroter hits a creature with an attack, casts a spell, or takes damage, the effect ends.

trait.name: Relentless (1/Turn)
entries: When the godcaller isn't {@condition incapacitated} and they are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, they can make an attack against a hostile creature (no action required) before the hit point reduction is resolved. If the attack hits and its damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the godcaller drops to 1 hit point instead of 0 hit points.

action.name: Power Chord (1st-Level Spell)
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one creature who can hear the godcaller. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) thunder damage.

action.name: Cadenza
entries: The godcaller chooses another creature within 30 feet of them. If the target can hear the godcaller, the target can use their reaction to move up to their speed and make an attack.

action.name: Song of the Gods (2nd-Level Spell)
entries: The godcaller and each creature of their choice within 30 feet of them that can hear them has advantage on attack rolls until the start of the godcaller's next turn. This effect ends early if the godcaller takes any damage.

bonus.name: Rallying Ostinato (1/Day)
entries: The godcaller and up to three creatures of their choice within 60 feet of them that can hear them regain 20 hit points, and these creatures ignore difficult terrain for 1 minute.

trait.name: Relentless (1/Turn)
entries: When the rampart isn't {@condition incapacitated} and they are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, they can make an attack against a hostile creature (no action required) before the hit point reduction is resolved. If the attack hits and its damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the rampart drops to 1 hit point instead of 0 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rampart makes two Spear attacks. If the rampart targets the same creature with both attacks, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than the rampart until the start of the rampart's next turn.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or ranged 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

reaction.name: No!
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the rampart targets another creature with an attack, the attacker must target the rampart instead.

trait.name: Relentless (1/Turn)
entries: When the terranova isn't {@condition incapacitated} and they are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, they can make an attack against a hostile creature (no action required) before the hit point reduction is resolved. If the attack hits and its damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the terranova drops to 1 hit point instead of 0 hit points.

trait.name: Tremorspeak
entries: The terranova can sense anything a willing creature within 30 feet of them can sense with tremorsense or Tremorspeak.

trait.name: Unhindered
entries: The terranova ignores difficult terrain.

action.name: Earth Pillar (1st-Level Spell)
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target touching the ground. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Quake
entries: The terranova chooses up to five creatures on the ground within 15 feet of them and stomps the ground. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Sinkhole
entries: The terranova chooses up to two creatures on the ground within 30 feet of them. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained}. A creature can use their action to free themself or another creature within their reach, ending the effect on that creature.

bonus.name: Unearth Mohlers (1/Day)
entries: The terranova stomps, and {@dice 1d3 + 1} mohlers pop out of the ground in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of them. The mohlers are friendly to the terranova and act immediately after them.

bonus.name: Rush
entries: The terranova takes the Dash action.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Earth Bump
entries: As the mohler burrows under a Large or smaller creature on the ground within 5 feet of them, the mohler shifts the ground. The creature above them must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Ground Grinder
entries: The mohler burrows up to their burrowing speed. Ground within 5 feet of where the mohler burrows becomes difficult terrain.

reaction.name: Zip
entries: If the mohler fails a Dexterity saving throw while burrowing, they succeed instead.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The scyza deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: War Harness
entries: While wearing a war harness, the scyza can carry up to thirty-six Medium or smaller creatures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scyza makes two Talon attacks.

action.name: Talon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage, and the target is knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is on top of the scyza, the target falls off and lands {@condition prone}.

action.name: Head Crest
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) slashing damage, and if the target is a creature who can hear, they are dazed until the end of their next turn by the crest's deep ringing.

action.name: Talon Twister {@recharge}
entries: The scyza claws at the ground in a flurry. Each creature of the scyza's choice within 5 feet of them must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) slashing damage, is knocked {@condition prone}, and is {@condition blinded} by a cloud of dust until the start of the scyza's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone} or {@condition blinded}.

monster.name: Dohma Raskovar

trait.name: Adrenaline Rush
entries: If Raskovar fails a saving throw, he can expend a use of his Dohma Rally without gaining its benefits (no action required), and succeed on the save instead.

trait.name: Relentless (1/Turn)
entries: When Raskovar isn't {@condition incapacitated} and he is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, he can make an attack against a hostile creature (no action required) before the hit point reduction is resolved. If the attack hits and its damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, Raskovar drops to 1 hit point instead of 0 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Raskovar makes three Repeating Crossbow attacks or two War Mace attacks.

action.name: War Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is dazed until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Repeating Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d12 + 1}) piercing damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Reinforcements (1/Day)
entries: Raskovar gains the benefits of the Dodge action, and ten orc blitzers appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of him.

bonus.name: Dohma Rally (3/Day)
entries: Raskovar regains 20 hit points, and he gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage until the end of his next turn.

reaction.name: On the House
entries: When a creature Raskovar can see within 30 feet of him fails an ability check or misses with an attack roll, that creature can reroll the check or attack, choosing either result.

legendaryHeader: Raskovar has three villain actions. He can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy creature's turn. He can take these actions in any order but can only use one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: Close In
entries: Each creature of Raskovar's choice within 60 feet of him that can hear him can move up to their speed. After this movement, each enemy within 5 feet of at least one creature who moved must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of Raskovar for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

legendary.name: Action 2: Lockdown
entries: Each creature of Raskovar's choice within 60 feet of him that can hear him can make a Strength (Athletics) check with advantage to grapple an enemy within their reach (no action required). Then Raskovar can move up to his speed.

legendary.name: Action 3: Do It Myself
entries: Raskovar moves up to his speed without provoking opportunity attacks. At the end of the movement, he can make up to five War Mace attacks with advantage.

hp.special: 15 times their level (number of d10 Hit Dice equal to twice their level)

trait.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: The blacksmith is proficient in smith's tools (+6 bonus).

action.name: Signature Attack (Warhammer)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.
Beginning at 7th level, the blacksmith can make this attack twice, instead of once, when they take the Attack action on their turn.

action.name: 3rd Level: Fire Bellows (3/Day)
entries: The blacksmith blows fire in a 15-foot cone or in a 30-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: 5th Level: Reinforce Armor (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the blacksmith touches a piece of armor and fortifies it. Roll a {@dice d4}. For 10 minutes, a creature wearing the armor gains a bonus to their AC equal to the result of the roll.

bonus.name: 7th Level: Fortify Weapon (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the blacksmith touches a weapon and polishes it. For 1 minute, the weapon is magical and deals an extra {@damage 1d8} damage.

hp.special: 7 + seven times caregiver's level (number of d8 Hit Dice equal to their caregiver's level)

action.name: Signature Attack (Claw)
entries: {@atk mw} +3 plus PB to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@dice 1d6} plus PB slashing damage.

action.name: 1st Level
entries: Earth Bump (2 Ferocity). The mohler burrows up to their speed and chooses one Large or smaller creature they come within 5 feet of during the move. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} plus PB Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: 3rd Level
entries: Sinkhole (5 Ferocity). The mohler burrows up to their speed and targets a creature they can sense on the surface within 10 feet of them. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} plus PB Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the ground until the start of the mohler's next turn.

action.name: 5th Level
entries: Terranova (8 Ferocity). Each creature on the ground within 10 feet of the mohler must succeed on a {@dc 10} plus PB Strength saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} plus PB bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. A creature who fails this saving throw by 5 or more is {@condition restrained} by the ground (save ends at end of turn).
A creature can use their action to free themself or another creature within their reach, ending the effect.

reaction.name: Quick Pit (1/Day)
entries: If the mohler's caregiver fails a Dexterity saving throw while they are within 10 feet of the mohler and the mohler isn't {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}, the mohler pulls the caregiver out of danger. The caregiver succeeds on the saving throw instead.

variant.name: Mystic Connection: Mohler
entries: If you're playing a {@link beastheart|https://shop.mcdmproductions.com/products/beastheart-companions} and have a mohler companion, you gain the following benefit at 9th level when you gain the beastheart's Mystic Connection feature:

entries.name: Earthen Strength
entries: As a bonus action, your limbs grow dense and swing with incredible force for 1 minute. For the duration, when you hit a creature no more than one size category larger or smaller than you with a melee weapon attack, the creature is also knocked {@condition prone}. Once you use this benefit, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The voiceless talker manifests a power and makes a Tentacle or Psionic Pistol attack.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) psychic damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}).

action.name: Psionic Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) force damage.

action.name: Memory Thief (4th-Order Power)
entries: The voiceless talker psionically plunders the mind of a creature they can see within 30 feet of them. The target must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw.

On a failed save, the target takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage, and until they finish a long rest or die, their proficiency bonus is lowered by 1 and the voiceless talker gains a cumulative +2 bonus to damage rolls. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and doesn't have their proficiency bonus reduced.
A creature whose proficiency bonus drops to 0 can't form new thoughts or speak, and they have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws.

action.name: Flay (3/Day; 5th-Order Power)
entries: The voiceless talker shoots a 15- foot cone of psionic energy from their eyes. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Guise (3rd-Order Power)
entries: The voiceless talker projects a psionic image over their body, transforming their appearance for 1 hour into that of a Medium creature they have seen. When they manifest this power, they can also change the appearance of any equipment they carry for the duration.

The changes wrought by this power fail to hold up to physical inspection. A creature can use an action to inspect the voiceless talker's appearance and make a {@dc 15} Intelligence (Investigation) check, noticing the image is a projection on a success.

reaction.name: Brain Drain
entries: When a creature {@condition grappled} by the voiceless talker makes a saving throw against one of the voiceless talker's powers, the voiceless talker momentarily weakens the creature and the creature has disadvantage on the saving throw.

trait.name: Phasing Rifle (1/Turn)
entries: When the artillerist hits a target with their Psionic Rifle attack, the artillerist can attempt to teleport the target (no action required). The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be teleported to an unoccupied space of the artillerist's choice they can see within 60 feet of the artillerist. The chosen space must be on a surface or in a liquid that can support the target without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The artillerist makes two Psionic Rifle attacks, or they manifest a power and make a Tentacle attack.

action.name: Psionic Rifle
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) force damage.

action.name: Phasing Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) psychic damage, and the artillerist can choose one of the following effects: the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}) or teleported up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space the artillerist can see.

action.name: Memory Thief (5th-Order Power)
entries: The artillerist psionically plunders the mind of a creature they can see within 30 feet of them. The target must make a {@dc 17} Intelligence saving throw.

On a failed save, the target takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) psychic damage, and until they finish a long rest or die, their proficiency bonus is lowered by 1 and the artillerist gains a cumulative +2 bonus to damage rolls. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and doesn't have their proficiency bonus reduced.
A creature whose proficiency bonus drops to 0 can't form new thoughts or speak, and they have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws.

action.name: Guise (3rd-Order Power)
entries: The artillerist projects a psionic image over their body, transforming their appearance for 1 hour into that of a Medium creature they have seen. When they manifest this power, they can also change the appearance of any equipment they carry for the duration.

The changes wrought by this power fail to hold up to physical inspection. A creature can use an action to inspect the artillerist's appearance and make a {@dc 17} Intelligence (Investigation) check, noticing the image is a projection on a success.

bonus.name: Vanish for One (3/Day; 3rd-Order Power; Concentration)
entries: The artillerist cloaks themself from the sight of a creature the artillerist can see within 60 feet of them. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or the artillerist becomes {@condition invisible} to the creature for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). This effect ends early if the artillerist attacks the creature, deals damage to them, or creates an effect that forces them to make a saving throw.

trait.name: Psionic Immunity
entries: The hulking brain is unaffected by psionic powers manifested by voiceless talkers unless the brain wishes to be.

trait.name: Psychic Scream
entries: When the brain drops to 0 hit points, each creature within 30 feet of them must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brain makes three Bash attacks.

action.name: Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and has disadvantage on saving throws against psionic powers.
The brain can grapple up to four creatures at once.

action.name: Squeeze
entries: Each creature {@condition grappled} by the brain must make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Psionic Invigoration (1/Day)
entries: Each willing voiceless talker within 60 feet of the brain regains the use of one psionic power of the voiceless talker's choice, and the voiceless talker has advantage on attack rolls until the end of the brain's next turn.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The mindkiller can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Psionic Immunity
entries: The mindkiller is unaffected by psionic powers manifested by voiceless talkers unless the mindkiller wishes to be.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the mindkiller can't use their Claws to attack another target.

action.name: Concealing Strike
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) psychic damage, and the mindkiller is {@condition invisible} to the target until the end of the mindkiller's next turn.

action.name: Mindwipe
entries: A Humanoid {@condition grappled} by the mindkiller must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or the mindkiller enters the Humanoid's body. While inside a Humanoid, the mindkiller has total cover against attacks and other effects originating outside the Humanoid, and the only action the mindkiller can take is to leave the body, exiting in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body.

When a Humanoid ends their turn with the mindkiller inside of them, they must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 10 necrotic damage. If the Humanoid is reduced to 0 hit points, they die and the mindkiller takes over the body, which regains hit points equal to the Humanoid's hit point maximum. The mindkiller retains their Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, their understanding of Deep Speech and Undercommon, and their telepathy. They otherwise adopt the target's statistics and can take the actions the creature could take. They know everything the creature knew, including spells, class features, traits, and languages. If the body is reduced to 0 hit points after the mindkiller takes control, the mindkiller must leave it.

A creature wielding a sharp tool or weapon within reach of a Humanoid host or body with a mindkiller inside can use an action to attempt to remove the mindkiller, making an attack roll against the Humanoid's AC if the host is unwilling. On a hit, the creature deals 11 ({@damage 2d10}) slashing damage to the host and must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom (Medicine) check. On a successful check, the creature cuts the mindkiller out of the host. On a faiIed check, if this slashing damage reduced the host to 0 hit points, the mindkiller kills the host; otherwise, there is no effect.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The whelp can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Minion
entries: If the whelp takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the whelp takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum, otherwise they take no damage.

trait.name: Psionic Immunity
entries: The whelp is unaffected by psionic powers manifested by voiceless talkers unless they wish to be.

trait.name: Resistance Drain
entries: When a hostile creature within 5 feet of three or more whelps makes a saving throw against a power or psionic effect, the creature takes a penalty to the save equal to the number of whelps within 5 feet of them.

action.name: Claws (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 slashing damage.

monster.name: Lord Syuul

trait.name: Draw In
entries: If Lord Syuul fails a saving throw while grappling at least one hostile creature, he can choose to release all {@condition grappled} creatures and succeed on the saving throw instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Lord Syuul makes two Tentacle or Psionic Repeater attacks then manifests a power or uses Memory Transfer.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) psychic damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}).

action.name: Psionic Repeater
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) force damage.

action.name: Brain Overload (1/Day; 6th-Order Power)
entries: Lord Syuul creates a sudden surge of energy in the mind of a creature he can see within 120 feet of him. The target must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 77 ({@damage 14d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the target has a head and is reduced to 0 hit points, their head explodes, and if they can't survive without a head, they die.

action.name: Flay (6th-Order Power)
entries: Lord Syuul shoots a 15-foot cone of psionic energy from his eyes. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 19} Intelligence saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Memory Transfer
entries: Lord Syuul psionically plunders the mind of each creature he is grappling. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Intelligence saving throw or take 44 ({@damage 8d10}) psychic damage. If a target fails their saving throw and doesn't escape the grapple by the end of their next turn, they must choose one of these effects:

items: The target's proficiency bonus drops to 0, they can't form new thoughts or speak, and they have disadvantage on all ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. Only the cure ailment power, {@spell lesser restoration} spell, or similar supernatural effects can return the target's proficiency bonus to normal.

The target is {@condition charmed} by Lord Syuul for 1 hour. While the target is {@condition charmed}, Lord Syuul can issue the target telepathic commands (no action required), which the target does their best to obey. Each time the target takes damage, they can make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw, ending the condition on a success.

entries: Additionally, until Lord Syuul finishes a long rest, he gains a cumulative +5 bonus to damage rolls.

action.name: Guise (3rd-Order Power)
entries: Lord Syuul projects a psionic image over his body, transforming that transforms his appearance for 1 hour into that of a Medium creature he has seen. When he manifests this power, he can also change the appearance of any equipment he carries.

The changes wrought by this power fail to hold up to physical inspection. A creature can use an action to inspect Lord Syuul's appearance and make a {@dc 19} Intelligence (Investigation) check, noticing the image is a projection on a success.

bonus.name: Grappling Jaunt
entries: Lord Syuul and each creature {@condition grappled} by him teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

reaction.name: Brain Drain
entries: When a creature {@condition grappled} by Lord Syuul makes a saving throw against Memory Transfer, Lord Syuul momentarily weakens the creature and the creature has disadvantage on the saving throw.

legendaryHeader: Lord Syuul has three villain actions. He can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy creature's turn. He can take these actions in any order but can only use one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: Mindblind
entries: Each creature of Lord Syuul's choice he can see within 60 feet of him must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can't see creatures other than Lord Syuul for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

legendary.name: Action 2: Was I Ever Here?
entries: Lord Syuul becomes {@condition invisible}, teleports 60 feet to an unoccupied space he can see, and can take the Hide action. At the same time, an illusory psionic image of Lord Syuul appears in the space he left, gesturing, speaking, and behaving as he chooses (no action required). A creature who touches the image or makes a melee attack against it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it. Lord Syuul's invisibility ends and his image disappears at the end of his next turn.

legendary.name: Action 3: Mindshatter
entries: Each creature of Lord Syuul's choice he can see within 60 feet of him must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom throw. On a failed save, a target takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) psychic damage and is dazed for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).
On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't dazed.

monster.name: Dancing Lady
languages: understands Druidic and Sylvan but can't speak

trait.name: Dancing Flowers
entries: The dancing lady has three spinning flowers resembling life-sized dancing Humanoids. Each flower has AC 16, 5 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage, and immunity to psychic damage. Attack rolls against these whirling blooms have disadvantage. Destroying a flower deals no damage to the dancing lady, who regrows destroyed flowers at the end of their turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dancing lady makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Blood-Red Waltz
entries: For each flower the dancing lady has, they can choose one creature they can see within 60 feet of them. Each target must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw as a dancing flower sweeps toward them. On a failed save, a creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and is moved to an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the dancing lady. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't moved.

action.name: Disarming Quickstep
entries: For each flower the dancing lady has, they can choose one creature they can see within 60 feet of them.

Each target must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw as a dancing flower whirls them into a dance. On a failed save, a creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) bludgeoning damage and is dazed until the start of the dancing lady's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't dazed.

action.name: Ballet of Terror (1/Day)
entries: The dancing lady's flowers pirouette and emit acrid mist. Creatures of the dancing lady's choice within 120 feet of them that can smell the mist must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition frightened} of the dancing lady for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

reaction.name: Somber Dirge
entries: When a creature the dancing lady can see hits the dancing lady with an attack, the dancing lady causes the attack to hit one of their flowers instead.

trait.name: Supernatural Resistance
entries: The stag has advantage on saving throws against powers, spells, and other supernatural effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The stag makes three Ram or Lightburst attacks.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lightburst
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) radiant damage, and the target is outlined in a golden light, giving attack rolls against them advantage until the start of the stag's next turn.

action.name: Starcall (1/Day)
entries: The stag calls down a magical shower of stars on an area that is 60 feet long and 5 feet wide within 120 feet of the stag. Each hostile creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Each willing friendly creature in that area regains 15 hit points.

The stars then create a 10-foot-high wall of opaque radiant light in that area. Each creature in the wall's space is pushed out of it by the shortest route. The creature chooses which side of the wall to end up on. The wall lasts for 1 minute or until the stag is {@condition incapacitated} or dies. If a hostile creature moves through the wall of light, willingly or otherwise, the creature must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Starlight Infusion
entries: The stag infuses radiant energy into a willing creature they can see within 60 feet of them. That creature deals an extra 5 radiant damage with weapon attack rolls until the start of the stag's next turn.

reaction.name: Nature's Ward
entries: When the stag or a creature they can see within 30 feet of them takes damage, the stag magically creates a protective barrier around that creature. The barrier reduces that damage to the protected creature by 20, then vanishes.

item.name: Banner of Glory
entries: While holding the banner, you can use an action to wave it heroically to inspire willing creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you. An affected creature immediately gains the benefits of a short rest. Once used, the banner can't be used again for 24 hours.

condition.name: Dazed
entries: A dazed creature can only do one of the following things on their turn: move, use an action, or use a bonus action. If a creature becomes dazed during their turn, their turn ends.
